Creates an instance of a .
A Lifetime can be used to represent the creation and expiration times of a security token.
member.param: creation time, will be converted to UTC.
expiration time will be converted to UTC.
member.remarks: Value will be stored in UTC.

expiration time will be converted to UTC.

member.summary: Computes the session key based on PSHA1 algorithm.
member.param: The entropy from the requestor side.
The entropy from the token issuer side.
The desired key size in bits.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.Psha1KeyGenerator.GenerateSymmetricKey(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Generates a ramdon key material for receiverEntropy and uses that to create a combined-entropy key.
member.param: The key size in bits.
Requestor's entropy.
The issuer's entropy.
member.returns: The computed symmetric key based on PSHA1 algorithm.
member.exception: When keySizeInBits is not a whole number of bytes.

member.summary: This generates the entropy using random number. This is usually used on the sending side to generate the requestor's entropy.
member.param: The array to fill with cryptographically strong random nonzero bytes.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.Psha1KeyGenerator.GenerateRandomBytes(System.Int32)
member.summary: This method generates a random byte array used as entropy with the given size.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.Renewing

member.remarks: The Renewing element is used to indicate a preference if token can be renewed or renewed after expiration.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage
member.summary:
Defines supported elements of WsTrust Request and Response messages.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.ActAs
member.summary:
Gets or sets a SecurityTokenElement representing the ActAs element used to convey information about the identity to be represented in the token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/v1.4/ws-trust.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.AdditionalContext
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value representing the AdditionalContext used to convey desired properties of the token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/wsfed/federation/v1.2/os/ws-federation-1.2-spec-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.AppliesTo
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value representing the AppliesTo element that specifies the scope for which the security token is desired.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html#_Toc162064962

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.AuthenticationType
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string representing the AuthenticationType element that indicates the type of authencation desired, usually specified as a URI.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if AuthenticationType is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.BinaryExchange
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value representing the BinaryExchange element that is used to exchange binary blobs as part of the existing negotiation.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.CanonicalizationAlgorithm
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string representing the CanonicalizationAlgorithm desired method to use in the returned token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if CanonicalizationAlgorithm is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.Claims
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value representing the Claims element used to request a specific set of claims.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.ComputedKeyAlgorithm
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string that represents the desired algorithm to use when computed keys are used.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if ComputedKeyAlgorithm is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.Context
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string that reprents the Context attribute that established for a set of RSTR messages.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if Context is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.Delegatable
member.summary:
Gets or sets a boolean that specifies if the returned token should be able to be delegated.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.DelegateTo
member.summary:
Gets or sets the Identity to which the Issued Token is delegated to.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if DelegateTo is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.Entropy
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value presenting the Entropy element that is used to provide proposed key material.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.Encryption
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that represents the Encryption element that indicates the requester desires any secrets to be encrypted with a specific token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string that indicates the desired EncryptionAlgorithm to use.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if EncryptionAlgorithm is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.EncryptWith
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string that indicates the desired encryption algorithm to use with the issued security token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if EncryptWith is null or an empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.Forwardable
member.summary:
Gets or sets a boolean that specifies if the Issued Token should be marked forwardable.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.KeySizeInBits
member.summary:
Gets or sets this element that defines the KeySize element inside the RequestSecurityToken message It is specified in bits.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.KeyType
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string that indicates the desired type of key in the security token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if KeyType is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.KeyWrapAlgorithm
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string that indicates the desired key wrapping algorithm.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if KeyWrapAlgorithm is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.Lifetime
member.summary:
Gets or sets the a value that represents the Lifetime element used to specify the desired valid time range.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if Lifetime is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.Issuer
member.summary:
Gets or sets an EndpointReference that represents the Issuer element used to specify the issuer of the security token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.OnBehalfOf
member.summary:
Gets or sets an EndpointReference that represents the Issuer element used to specify the issuer of the security token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.Participants
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that represents the Participants element used to specify the participants sharing the security token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.PolicyReference
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value that represents the PolicyReference element used to specify the participants sharing the security token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.ProofEncryption
member.summary:
Gets or sets a SecurityTokenElement that represents the ProofEncryption element used to specify the any secrets in proof-of-possession tokens to be encrypted for the specified token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.SecondaryParameters
member.summary:
Gets of sets a WsTrustRequest that represents the Secondary element for which the requester is not the originator.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.SignatureAlgorithm
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string that represents the SignatureAlgorithm that indicates the desired signature algorithm to sign the issued security token with.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if ComputedKeyAlgorithm is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.SignWith
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string that represents the SignWith element that indicates the desired signature algorithm to be used with the issued security token by the receiver.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if ComputedKeyAlgorithm is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.TokenType
member.summary:
Gets or sets a string that represents the TokenType element.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: if TokenType is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.WsTrustVersion
member.exception: thrown if ComputedKeyAlgorithm is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.UseKey
member.summary:
Gets or sets an value that represents the UseKey element used to specify that the requester wishes to use an existing key rather than create a new one.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
member.exception: thrown if UseKey is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.AdditionalXmlAttributes
member.summary: Gets additional attributes that should be added to or were found when reading or writing a trust message.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustMessage.AdditionalXmlElements
member.summary: Gets additional elements that should be added to or were found when reading or writing a trust message.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustRequest
member.summary:
Represents the contents of the RequestSecurityToken element. A WsTrustRequest can be serialized into a WsTrust request and sent to a token service to obtain a security token.
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
for serializing and de-serializing the request.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustRequest.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of . the type of this request.
member.exception: Thrown if is null or empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustRequest.AllowPostdating
member.summary: Gets or sets if the token requested can be postdated.

member.name: P:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustRequest.RequestType
member.exception: Thrown if RequestType is null or empty.

member.name: T:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustResponse
member.summary:
Represents the contents of the RequestSecurityTokenCollection element. A WsTrustResponse is received from a STS in response to a WsTrust request..
see: http://docs.oasis-open.org/ws-sx/ws-trust/200512/ws-trust-1.3-os.html
for serializing and de-serializing the response.

member.name: M:Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.WsTrustResponse.#ctor(Microsoft.IdentityModel.Protocols.WsTrust.RequestSecurityTokenResponse)
member.param: the response to add to the collection.
